About

DataHack

DataHack 2015 is the first data-driven hackathon in Israel, designed to bring together the Israeli data community. Set to take place at the end of November, DataHack will host over a hundred data-enthusiastic programmers, designers and researchers, competing over 48 hours and combining their skills to build innovative solutions for real-world problems.

Location

DataHack will be hosted at the Hansen House - Center for Design, Media and Technology. The center includes exhibition spaces, an animation lab, theater performance space, a projection room, studios for visiting artists and the Graduate Programs of the Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design Jerusalem.




Date

DataHack 2015 will take place on Noveber 25th-27th, 2015. The event will start on Wednesday, November 25th, at 15:00 and run until Friday, November 27th at 15:00. See below for a detailed scheduled.

Participation

Registration to the event is open to anyone - students, industry professionals, even cats! Applications will be carefully reviewed for skills and experience, and one hundred applicants will be selected to form a balanced crows of engineers, researchers and designers ready to tackle the challenges ahead.
